intro: Stebbinsoseris, commonly known as the desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Stebbinsoseris thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and desert landscapes. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
